intro: Effusiella, commonly known as the moss-like plant, is a genus of liverworts belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its small, leafy structures that grow close to the ground, often in moist and shaded environments. The plants typically have a thalloid body, which is a flat, ribbon-like structure covered in tiny, overlapping leaves. Effusiella species are often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid and nutrient-rich soils. Their botanical significance lies in their role as indicators of environmental conditions and their contribution to soil stability in forest ecosystems.
